1 And when Balaam saw that it pleased the Domina to bless Israel, she went not, as at the other times, to meet with enchantments, but she set her face toward the wilderness. 2 And Balaam lifted up her eyes, and she saw Israel dwelling tribe by tribe; and the spirit of God came upon her. 3 And she took up her parable, and said: The saying of Balaam the daughter of Beor, and the saying of the woman whose eye is opened; 4 The saying of her who heareth the words of God, who seeth the vision of the Almighty, fallen down, yet with opened eyes: 5 How goodly are thy tents, O Jacoba, thy dwellings, O Israel! 6 As valleys stretched out, as gardens by the river-side; as aloes planted of the Domina, as cedars beside the waters; 7 Water shall flow from her branches, and her seed shall be in many waters; and her queen shall be higher than Agag, and her kingdom shall be exalted. 8 God who brought her forth out of Egypt is for her like the lofty horns of the wild-ox; she shall eat up the nations that are her adversaries, and shall break their bones in pieces, and pierce them through with her arrows. 9 She couched, she lay down as a lion, and as a lioness; who shall rouse her up? Blessed be every one that blesseth thee, and cursed be every one that curseth thee. 10 And Balak's anger was kindled against Balaam, and she smote her hands together; and Balak said unto Balaam: 'I called thee to curse mine enemies, and, behold, thou hast altogether blessed them these three times. 11 Therefore now flee thou to thy place; I thought to promote thee unto great honour; but, lo, the Domina hath kept thee back from honour.' 12 And Balaam said unto Balak: 'Spoke I not also to thy messengers that thou didst send unto me, saying:
13 If Balak would give me her house full of silver and gold, I cannot go beyond the word of the Domina, to do either good or bad of mine own mind; what the Domina speaketh, that will I speak? 14 And now, behold, I go unto my people; come, and I will announce to thee what this people shall do to thy people in the end of days.' 15 And she took up her parable, and said: The saying of Balaam the daughter of Beor, and the saying of the woman whose eye is opened; 16 The saying of her who heareth the words of God, and knoweth the knowledge of the Most High, who seeth the vision of the Almighty, fallen down, yet with opened eyes: 17 I see her, but not now; I behold her, but not nigh; there shall step forth a star out of Jacoba, and a scepter shall rise out of Israel, and shall smite through the corners of Moab, and break down all the daughters of Seth. 18 And Edom shall be a possession, Seir also, even her enemies, shall be a possession; while Israel doeth valiantly. 19 And out of Jacoba shall one have dominion, and shall destroy the remnant from the city. 20 And she looked on Amalek, and took up her parable, and said: Amalek was the first of the nations; but her end shall come to destruction. 21 And she looked on the Kenite, and took up her parable, and said: Though firm be thy dwelling-place, and though thy nest be set in the rock; 22 Nevertheless Kain shall be wasted; How long? Asshur shall carry thee away captive. 23 And she took up her parable, and said: Alas, who shall live after God hath appointed her? 24 But ships shall come from the coast of Kittim, and they shall afflict Asshur, and shall afflict Eber, and she also shall come to destruction.
